path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Agency for International Development (USAID)
name: [usagov] Agency for International Development (USAID)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. Agency for International Development
usagov_description: The U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) is the principal U.S. agency to extend assistance to countries recovering from disaster, trying to escape poverty, and engaging in democratic reforms.
usagov_forms_title: U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) Forms

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Agency for Global Media
name: [usagov] Agency for Global Media
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. Agency for Global Media
usagov_description: The U.S. Agency for Global Media, formerly known as the Broadcasting Board of Governors, broadcasts news and information about the United States and the world to audiences abroad.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] African Development Foundation
name: [usagov] African Development Foundation
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the African Development Foundation
usagov_description: The African Development Foundation provides grants to community groups and small enterprises that benefit under-served and marginalized groups in Africa.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Advisory Council on Historic Preservation
name: [usagov] Advisory Council on Historic Preservation
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Advisory Council on Historic Preservation
usagov_description: The Advisory Council on Historic Preservation encourages the preservation of historic properties across the nation.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts
name: [usagov] Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts
usagov_description: The Administrative Office of the United States Courts handles the nonjudicial, administrative business of the United States Courts such as maintaining statistics and managing Court budgets.
usagov_name: Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts
usagov_website_0_title: Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Administrative Conference of the United States
name: [usagov] Administrative Conference of the United States
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Administrative Conference of the United States
usagov_description: The Administrative Conference of the United States is an independent federal agency dedicated to improving federal agency administrative processes and procedures.
usagov_name: Administrative Conference of the United States
usagov_website_0_title: Administrative Conference of the United States

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Access Board
name: [usagov] Access Board
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. Access Board
usagov_description: The Access Board is an independent federal agency devoted to accessibility for people with disabilities. The Board develops and maintains design criteria for the built environment, transit vehicles, telecommunications equipment, and for electronic and information technology.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] AbilityOne Commission
name: [usagov] AbilityOne Commission
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. AbilityOne Commission
usagov_description: The AbilityOne Commission creates job opportunities for people who are blind or have other significant disabilities in the manufacture and delivery of products and services to the Federal Government.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Armed Forces Retirement Home
name: [usagov] Armed Forces Retirement Home
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Armed Forces Retirement Home
usagov_description: The Gulfport and Washington campuses of the Armed Forces Retirement Home are retirement centers for veterans of the U.S. military.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Arctic Research Commission
name: [usagov] Arctic Research Commission
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. Arctic Research Commission
usagov_description: The U.S. Arctic Research Commission develops and recommends a national Arctic research policy.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Archives, National Archives and Records Administration (NARA)
name: [usagov] Archives, National Archives and Records Administration (NARA)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the National Archives and Records Administration
usagov_description: The National Archives and Records Administration preserves U.S. government records, manages the Presidential Libraries system, and publishes laws, regulations, Presidential, and other public documents.
usagov_name: Archives, National Archives and Records Administration (NARA)

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Appalachian Regional Commission
name: [usagov] Appalachian Regional Commission
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Appalachian Regional Commission
usagov_description: The Appalachian Regional Commission works for sustainable community and economic development in Appalachia.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Amtrak (AMTRAK)
name: [usagov] Amtrak (AMTRAK)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the National Railroad Passenger Corporation (AMTRAK)
usagov_description: Amtrak, the National Railroad Passenger Corporation, provides intercity rail passenger service.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] AmeriCorps
name: [usagov] AmeriCorps
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact AmeriCorps
usagov_description: Formerly known as the Corporation for National and Community Service, AmeriCorps, and AmeriCorps Seniors engage volunteers in serving directly with nonprofit organizations to tackle the nation's most pressing challenges.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] American Battle Monuments Commission
name: [usagov] American Battle Monuments Commission
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the American Battle Monuments Commission
usagov_contact_1_title: Order Floral Decorations for Grave Sites
usagov_description: The American Battle Monuments Commission manages 24 overseas military cemeteries, and 25 memorials, monuments, and markers. Nearly all the cemeteries and memorials honor those who served in World War I or World War II.
usagov_local_offices_1_title: Search for Individuals Buried or Memorialized Overseas

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection
name: [usagov] Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
usagov_description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau helps consumers by providing educational materials and accepting complaints. It supervises banks, lenders, and large non-bank entities, such as credit reporting agencies and debt collection companies. The Bureau also works to make credit card, mortgage, and other loan disclosures clearer, so consumers can understand their rights and responsibilities.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program
name: [usagov] Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program
usagov_description: The Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program awards scholarships to college students who intend to pursue careers in science, mathematics, and engineering.
usagov_local_offices_0_title: Find a Goldwater Scholarship Faculty Representative
usagov_name: Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program
usagov_website_0_title: Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Bankruptcy Courts
name: [usagov] Bankruptcy Courts
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Bankruptcy Courts
usagov_description: Each of the 94 federal judicial districts  handles bankruptcy matters, and in almost all districts, bankruptcy cases are filed in the bankruptcy court. Bankruptcy laws help people who can no longer pay their creditors get a fresh start by liquidating their assets to pay their debts, or by creating a repayment plan.
usagov_local_offices_0_title: Find Bankruptcy Courts Offices Near You

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Citizens' Stamp Advisory Committee
name: [usagov] Citizens' Stamp Advisory Committee
usagov_description: The Citizens' Stamp Advisory Committee evaluates all stamp proposals. The Committee's primary goal is to select subjects of broad national interest for recommendation to the Postmaster General that are both interesting and educational.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Circuit Courts of Appeal
name: [usagov] Circuit Courts of Appeal
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. Courts of Appeal
usagov_description: The U.S. Courts of Appeal hear appeals from lower courts of both civil and criminal trials, but do not investigate the facts of a case. Rather, the Appeals Courts investigate whether or not the law has been fairly and correctly applied by the lower courts.
usagov_forms_title: U.S. Circuit Courts of Appeal Forms

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Chief Information Officers Council
name: [usagov] Chief Information Officers Council
usagov_description: The CIO Council is the principal interagency forum on Federal agency practices for information technology management.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Chief Human Capital Officers Council
name: [usagov] Chief Human Capital Officers Council
usagov_description: The Chief Human Capital Officers Council works to modernize human resources systems, improve the quality of human resources information, and advises on legislation affecting human resources operations.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Chief Financial Officers Council
name: [usagov] Chief Financial Officers Council
usagov_description: The Chief Financial Officers Council works to improve financial management in the U.S. government.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Chief Acquisition Officers Council
name: [usagov] Chief Acquisition Officers Council
usagov_description: The Chief Acquisition Officers Council monitors and improves the federal acquisition system.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Chemical Safety Board
name: [usagov] Chemical Safety Board
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Chemical Safety Board
usagov_description: The Chemical Safety Board investigates industrial chemical accidents.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Central Intelligence Agency (CIA)
name: [usagov] Central Intelligence Agency (CIA)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Central Intelligence Agency
usagov_description: The Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) collects, evaluates, and disseminates vital information on economic, military, political, scientific, and other developments abroad to safeguard national security.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces
name: [usagov] Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces
usagov_description: The Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces is an appeals court with worldwide jurisdiction for anyone subject to the Uniform Code of Military Justice.
usagov_name: Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces
usagov_website_0_title: Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency
name: [usagov] Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency
usagov_contact_0_title: Inspectors General Directory
usagov_contact_1_title: Report Government Waste, Fraud and Abuse
usagov_description: The Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency address integrity, economy, and effectiveness issues in the federal government.
usagov_name: Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency
usagov_website_0_title: Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Coordinating Council on Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention
name: [usagov] Coordinating Council on Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Coordinating Council on Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention
usagov_description: The Coordinating Council on Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention coordinates, studies the effectiveness of, and makes recommendations on juvenile crime prevention activities.
usagov_name: Coordinating Council on Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention
usagov_website_0_title: Coordinating Council on Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC)
name: [usagov] Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Consumer Product Safety Commission
usagov_description: The Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) protects the public from unreasonable risks of serious injury or death from thousands of types of consumer products under its jurisdiction, including products that pose a fire, electrical, chemical, or mechanical hazard or can injure children.
usagov_website_2_title: Report incidents, injuries, or safety concerns

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Congress—U.S. Senate
name: [usagov] Congress—U.S. Senate
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. Senate
usagov_description: The U.S. Senate and the U.S. House of Representatives make up the two chambers of Congress.  The Senate has 100 members, 2 from each state, who are elected to serve for a term of 6 years.
usagov_website_3_title: Officers and Staff of the Senate

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Congress—U.S. House of Representatives
name: [usagov] Congress—U.S. House of Representatives
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. House of Representatives
usagov_description: The U.S. House of Representatives and the U.S. Senate make up the two chambers of Congress. The House has 435 members, the number representing each state is determined by population.
usagov_website_3_title: Officers and Organizations of the House

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC)
name: [usagov] Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Commodity Futures Trading Commission
usagov_description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission protects the public from fraud, manipulation, and abusive practices related to the sale of commodity and financial futures and options, and to fosters open, competitive, and financially sound futures and option markets. They investigate and prosecute commodities fraud, including foreign currency schemes, energy manipulation and hedge fund fraud, and works with other federal and state agencies to bring criminal and other actions.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe (Helsinki Commission)
name: [usagov] Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe (Helsinki Commission)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe (Helsinki Commission)
usagov_description: The Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe monitors and encourages compliance with the Helsinki Final Act and other Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe commitments.
usagov_name: Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe (Helsinki Commission)
usagov_website_0_title: Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe (Helsinki Commission)

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Commission on International Religious Freedom
name: [usagov] Commission on International Religious Freedom
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom
usagov_description: The U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom reviews the facts and circumstances of violations of religious freedom internationally and to make policy recommendations to the President, the Secretary of State and Congress.
usagov_website_0_title: U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Commission on Civil Rights
name: [usagov] Commission on Civil Rights
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Commission on Civil Rights
usagov_description: The U.S. Commission on Civil Rights is an independent, bipartisan agency charged with monitoring federal civil rights enforcement.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Commission of Fine Arts
name: [usagov] Commission of Fine Arts
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. Commission of Fine Arts
usagov_description: The U. S. Commission of Fine Arts advises the government on matters pertaining to the arts, and to guide the architectural development of Washington.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia
name: [usagov] Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia
usagov_description: The Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency provides supervision of adults on parole, probation, and supervised release in the District of Columbia.
usagov_forms_title: Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia
usagov_name: Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia
usagov_website_0_title: Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Court of International Trade
name: [usagov] Court of International Trade
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Court of International Trade
usagov_description: The United States Court of International Trade resolves trade disputes by interpreting and applying customs and international trade laws.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Court of Federal Claims
name: [usagov] Court of Federal Claims
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Court of Federal Claims
usagov_description: The U.S. Court of Federal Claims has jurisdiction over claims seeking money judgments against the United States.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims
name: [usagov] Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims
usagov_description: The Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims hears appeals of decisions made by the Board of Veterans Appeals. You must have a decision from the Board of Veterans Appeals to bring a case before this court.
usagov_forms_title: Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims Forms
usagov_name: Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims
usagov_website_0_title: U.S. Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Delta Regional Authority
name: [usagov] Delta Regional Authority
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Delta Regional Authority
usagov_description: The Delta Regional Authority is a partnership to improve economic and community growth in eight states. Those states are Alabama, Arkansas, Illinois, Kentucky, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri, and Tennessee.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Delaware River Basin Commission
name: [usagov] Delaware River Basin Commission
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Delaware River Basin Commission
usagov_description: In 1961, the federal government and the governments of Delaware, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and New York, entered into an agreement that created the Delaware River Basin Commission. The Commission has the independent legal authority to oversee and manage the Delaware River Basin.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board
name: [usagov] Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board
usagov_description: The Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board reviews the content and implementation of health and safety standards at Department of Energy Defense Nuclear Facilities. The board also makes recommendations to the President and Secretary of Energy regarding health and safety issues at Defense Nuclear Facilities.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Director of National Intelligence, Office of
name: [usagov] Director of National Intelligence, Office of
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Office of the Director of National Intelligence
usagov_description: The Office of the Director of National Intelligence integrates the intelligence gathering and analysis functions performed across the intelligence community to provide intelligence to decision makers.
usagov_main_address: Office of the Director of National Intelligence
usagov_name: Director of National Intelligence, Office of
usagov_website_0_title: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Denali Commission
name: [usagov] Denali Commission
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Denali Commission
usagov_description: The Denali Commission provides critical utilities, infrastructure, and economic support throughout Alaska.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC)
name: [usagov] Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission
usagov_description: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) enforces laws that make discrimination illegal in the workplace. The commission oversees all types of work situations including hiring, firing, promotions, harassment, training, wages, and benefits.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
name: [usagov] Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Environmental Protection Agency
usagov_description: The Environmental Protection Agency protects people and the environment from significant health risks, sponsors and conducts research, and develops and enforces environmental regulations.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Election Assistance Commission (EAC)
name: [usagov] Election Assistance Commission (EAC)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Election Assistance Commission
usagov_description: The Election Assistance Commission (EAC) supports state and local election officials in their efforts to ensure accessible, accurate. and secure elections. EAC develops guidance to meet the Help America Vote Act requirements, adopts voluntary voting system guidelines, and serves as a national clearinghouse of information on election administration. EAC also accredits testing laboratories and certifies voting systems, as well as audits the use of Help America Vote Act funds.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment
name: [usagov] Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment
usagov_description: The Under Secretary of State for Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment leads the State Department’s efforts to develop and implement international policies related to economic growth, energy, agriculture, the ocean, the environment, and science and technology.
usagov_name: Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment
usagov_website_0_title: Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Export-Import Bank of the United States
name: [usagov] Export-Import Bank of the United States
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Export-Import Bank of the United States
usagov_description: The Export-Import Bank assists American businesses export their goods by providing financial assistance in the form of loans, loan guarantees and insurance. The focus of the Export-Import Bank is on assisting small businesses.
usagov_name: Export-Import Bank of the United States
usagov_website_0_title: Export-Import Bank of the United States

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council
name: [usagov] Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council
usagov_description: The Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council is an interagency body that seeks to standardize the oversight criteria and methods of the various financial regulatory bodies.
usagov_forms_title: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Forms

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Election Commission
name: [usagov] Federal Election Commission
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Election Commission
usagov_description: The Federal Election Commission enforces federal campaign finance laws, including monitoring donation prohibitions, and limits and oversees public funding for presidential campaigns.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC)
name: [usagov] Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation
usagov_description: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) answers questions about federal deposit insurance coverage, and handles complaints and inquiries about FDIC-insured state banks which are not members of the Federal Reserve System.
usagov_main_address: Division of Depositor and Consumer Protection

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Communications Commission (FCC)
name: [usagov] Federal Communications Commission (FCC)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Communications Commission
usagov_contact_1_title: File a Complaint with the Federal Communications Commission
usagov_description: The Federal Communications Commission regulates interstate and international communications through cable, radio, television, satellite and wire. The goal of the Commission is to promote connectivity and ensure a robust and competitive market.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board
name: [usagov] Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board
usagov_description: The Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board works to improve government accountability by issuing federal financial accounting and reporting standards that conform to industry best practices.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Farm Credit System Insurance Corporation
name: [usagov] Farm Credit System Insurance Corporation
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Farm Credit System Insurance Corporation
usagov_description: The Farm Credit System Insurance Corporation ensures the payment of principal and interest on insured notes, bonds, and other obligations issued on behalf of Farm Credit System.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Farm Credit Administration
name: [usagov] Farm Credit Administration
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Farm Credit Administration
usagov_description: The Farm Credit Administration is an independent financial regulatory agency that oversees the Farm Credit System, a nationwide network of lending institutions that serve farmers, ranchers, agricultural cooperatives, and other eligible borrowers. It also oversees the Federal Agricultural Mortgage Corporation or Farmer Mac, which provides a secondary market for agricultural real estate mortgage loans, rural housing loans, and rural cooperative loans.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Trade Commission (FTC)
name: [usagov] Federal Trade Commission (FTC)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Trade Commission
usagov_description: The Federal Trade Commission works to prevent fraudulent, deceptive, and unfair business practices. They also provide information to help consumers spot, stop, and avoid scams and fraud.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board
name: [usagov] Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board
usagov_description: The Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board administers the Thrift Savings Plan, a tax-deferred retirement account similar to a 401(k).

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Reserve System
name: [usagov] Federal Reserve System
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Reserve System
usagov_contact_1_title: File a Complaint About a Bank
usagov_description: The Federal Reserve is the central bank of the United States. It formulates and administers credit and monetary policy.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission
name: [usagov] Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission
usagov_description: The Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission is an independent agency that administers trials and hears appeals of disputes relating directly to the Mine Safety and Health Act of 1977.
usagov_name: Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission
usagov_website_0_title: Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service
name: [usagov] Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service
usagov_description: The Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service provides mediation and other conflict resolution services for managing and enhancing labor-management relationships.
usagov_forms_title: Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service Forms

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Maritime Commission
name: [usagov] Federal Maritime Commission
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Maritime Commission
usagov_description: The Federal Maritime Commission is responsible for regulating the U.S. international ocean transportation system for the benefit of U.S. exporters, importers, and the U.S. consumer.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Library and Information Center Committee
name: [usagov] Federal Library and Information Center Committee
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Library and Information Center Committee
usagov_description: The Federal Library and Information Center Committee coordinates and shares available resources to provide continuing education and training to federal library and information center employees.
usagov_name: Federal Library and Information Center Committee
usagov_website_0_title: Federal Library and Information Center Committee

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer
name: [usagov] Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer
usagov_description: The Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer facilitates knowledge and technology sharing across federal laboratories, and speeds the adoption of new knowledge and technologies in the wider economy by facilitating the sharing federal research with non-governmental public and private entities.
usagov_name: Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer
usagov_website_0_title: Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Labor Relations Authority (FLRA)
name: [usagov] Federal Labor Relations Authority (FLRA)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Labor Relations Authority
usagov_description: The Federal Labor Relations Authority is a quasi-judicial body that manages relations between federal agencies and employees.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Judicial Center
name: [usagov] Federal Judicial Center
usagov_description: The Federal Judicial Center conducts policy research and provides continuing education resources for the judicial branch.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Interagency Council on Statistical Policy
name: [usagov] Federal Interagency Council on Statistical Policy
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Interagency Council on Statistical Policy (FedStats)
usagov_description: FedStats is a community of practice for over 100 agencies that produce and distribute official federal statistics.
usagov_name: Federal Interagency Council on Statistical Policy

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Housing Finance Agency
name: [usagov] Federal Housing Finance Agency
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Housing Finance Agency
usagov_description: The Federal Housing Finance Agency provides supervision, regulation, and housing mission oversight of Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, and the Federal Home Loan Banks.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal Geographic Data Committee
name: [usagov] Federal Geographic Data Committee
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Federal Geographic Data Committee
usagov_description: The Federal Geographic Data Committee is an interagency group that promotes and coordinates the production, use, and publication of geospatial data.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Government Ethics, Office of (OGE)
name: [usagov] Government Ethics, Office of (OGE)

usagov_description: A private corporation founded by Congress, the Federal Home Loan Mortgage corporation's mission is to promote stability and affordability in the housing market by purchasing mortgages from banks and other loan makers. The corporation is currently under conservatorship, under the direction of the Federal Housing Finance Agency.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Supreme Court of the United States/[usagov] Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit
name: [usagov] Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit
usagov_description: With a national jurisdiction, the Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit hears appeals on patent and certain civil cases from courts such as the U.S. Court of International Trade and the Court of Federal Claims, among others. The Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit may also review the administrative rulings of the Patent and Trademark Office, the Secretary of Commerce and other agencies.

usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the U.S. Department of Commerce
usagov_description: The Department of Commerce works with businesses, universities, communities, and the Nation’s workers to promote job creation, economic growth, sustainable development, and improved standards of living for Americans.

usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Department of Defense (public inquiries)
usagov_description: The Department of Defense provides the military forces needed to deter war, and to protect the security of the United States.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] White House/[usagov] Department of Veterans Affairs (VA)
name: [usagov] Department of Veterans Affairs (VA)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Department of Veterans Affairs
usagov_description: The Department of Veterans Affairs runs programs benefiting veterans and members of their families. It offers education opportunities and rehabilitation services and provides compensation payments for disabilities or death related to military service, home loan guaranties, pensions, burials, and health care that includes the services of nursing homes, clinics, and medical centers.

name: [usagov] Department of Transportation (DOT)

usagov_description: The Department of Transportation is responsible for planning and coordinating federal transportation projects. It also sets safety regulations for all major modes of transportation.

name: [usagov] Department of the Treasury
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Department of the Treasury
usagov_description: The Department of the Treasury manages Federal finances by collecting taxes and paying bills and by managing currency, government accounts and public debt. The Department of the Treasury also enforces finance and tax laws.

name: [usagov] Department of the Interior (DOI)
usagov_contact_0_title: Contact the Department of the Interior
usagov_description: The Department of the Interior manages public lands and minerals, national parks, and wildlife refuges and upholds Federal trust responsibilities to Indian tribes and Native Alaskans. Additionally, Interior is responsible for endangered species conservation and other environmental conservation efforts.
